extractions.description: This paper investigates the impact of object placement distribution in synthetic training data on the performance of vision-based object detection models in driving contexts. The authors propose that realistic object placement can significantly improve model performance and demonstrate this through experiments using CARLA and KITTI datasets.

title.value: Realistically distributing object placements in synthetic training data improves the performance of vision-based object detection models
title.justification: The title clearly describes the main finding and contribution of the paper.
title.quote: Realistically distributing object placements in synthetic training data improves the performance of vision-based object detection models

type.justification: The paper includes experiments and empirical results that demonstrate the impact of object placement distribution on model performance.
type.quote: In this paper we test the hypothesis that the realism of physical object placement distribution in synthetic data has a significant impact on the performance of vision models trained on said data. We use a carefully controlled experimental setup...

research_field.justification: The research focuses on improving the performance of vision-based object detection models, which falls under the domain of computer vision.
research_field.quote: ...how much of an impact the placement distribution in synthetic data can have on the performance of vision-based object detectors in driving contexts.

sub_research_field.justification: The paper specifically addresses the performance of object detection models and the effect of synthetic data on them.
sub_research_field.quote: ...shows that a realistic object placement distribution can have a dramatic impact on real-world performance when training object detectors on synthetic data in driving contexts.

name.justification: The PGD model is used in the experiments to evaluate the impact of synthetic data placement on object detection performance.
name.quote: We use a PGD [21] model for object detection.

type.justification: PGD is used for 3D vehicle detection as discussed in the paper.
type.quote: We train a 3D vehicle detection model named PGD [21]...

name.justification: The CARLA dataset is used to generate synthetic training data for the experiments.
name.quote: We use a carefully controlled experimental setup, where we generate training data using the CARLA driving simulator [3]...

name.justification: The KITTI dataset is used as the test data for evaluating the performance of the object detection models.
name.quote: ...we use real validation data provided in KITTI [5] as test data.

name.justification: MMDetection3D is utilized in the experimental setup as mentioned in the paper.
name.quote: MMDetection3D: OpenMMLab next-generation platform for general 3D object detection.
